etymology.description: 开 + 瓶 + 器 = bottle-opening device.
etymology.interpretation: Formed as a verb-object compound plus the suffix 器 ‘tool/device’, indicating a utensil designed to open bottles. A transparent, productive pattern: V + N + 器.
etymology.simplification: 開→开 was simplified by reducing the 門 component to a simpler form to lower stroke count and speed writing; 瓶 and 器 are unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我用开瓶器打开啤酒瓶(我用開瓶器打開啤酒瓶)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yòng kāipíngqì dǎkāi píjiǔ píng.
examples.english: I use a bottle opener to open a beer bottle.

examples.chinese: 这把开瓶器很结实(這把開瓶器很結實)。
examples.english: This bottle opener is very sturdy.

examples.chinese: 旅行时别忘了带开瓶器(旅行時別忘了帶開瓶器)。
examples.pinyin: Lǚxíng shí bié wàngle dài kāipíngqì.
examples.english: Don't forget to bring a bottle opener when traveling.
